title: 5a Systems Programming Quiz: CPU Scheduling and Algorithms

questions.question: CPU scheduling is the core of multiprogrammed operating systems.
In a single CPU core system, multiple processes can run simultaneously.
The ready queue in CPU scheduling is always implemented as a first-in, first-out (FIFO) queue.
Which of the following is NOT a state where CPU scheduling decisions may take place?
choices: Switches from running to waiting state
Switches from running to ready state

questions.question: What is the primary goal of CPU scheduling?
Which of the following is a scheduling criterion?
In the First Come First Served (FCFS) scheduling algorithm, the process that arrives first is always executed first.
Which scheduling algorithm prioritizes the process with the shortest CPU burst time?
What is a disadvantage of the First Come First Served (FCFS) scheduling algorithm?
choices: It may result in long waiting times
It requires knowledge of CPU burst times

questions.question: In Priority Scheduling, a process with the highest priority (smallest integer) is executed first.
What is a potential problem with Priority Scheduling?
Which of the following is a solution to the starvation problem in Priority Scheduling?
The Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling algorithm requires prior knowledge of CPU burst times.
Which of the following scheduling algorithms is non-preemptive?
What is the average waiting time for processes using the Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling algorithm with the following burst times: 3, 6, 9, 0?
In Priority Scheduling, aging is used to increase the priority of processes over time.
Which of the following is NOT a valid optimization criterion for CPU scheduling algorithms?
The CPU scheduler selects processes from the ready queue to allocate the CPU.
Which of the following is true about the CPU I/O burst cycle?
choices: Process execution begins with an I/O burst
Processes alternate between CPU bursts and I/O bursts
The final burst is always an I/O burst
CPU bursts are longer than I/O bursts

questions.question: In a multicore system, CPU scheduling is extended to all processing cores.
